page.title: 06HISTORY OF HEBBURN
page.content: Hebburn is situated on the banks of the River Tyne in the Borough of South Tyneside.It lies to the West of South Shields and to the East of Newcastle. The town is a mixture of industrial and residential areas.Industry is made up of heavy engineering and shipbuilding.The residential areas are mainly council owned estates with small pockets of private housing. The first recorded history dates from 797 where it is mentioned as being a fishermans' hamlet.The village was continually raided by the Scots over a long period.Coal mining has been carried out over the centuries and Sir Humphrey Davy tried out his safety lamp here. Andrew Leslie started shipbuilding here in 1853 and the population grew to its present level of 24000.
